main event: On August 22, 1957, a metallic grey, round object was observed at high altitude near Boston, Massachusetts. The object was stationary for at least 20 minutes and was unable to climb or show details.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 20 minutes, providing a significant amount of time for the witnesses to study the object.
The object appeared to be metallic grey and round in shape, adding to the mystery of its identity.
The report suggests that the object was assumed to be a balloon, indicating the difficulty in identifying the flying object.
A USA duty pilot was among the witnesses, adding credibility to the UFO sighting.
Despite the observation being assumed to be a balloon, the object's behavior, such as being stationary at high altitude, raises questions about its true nature.
sighted object: metallic grey, round object at high altitude
